reviewText: Cute! Very Soft,100% Cotton remember in sizing to allow for shrinkage. Oh! I forgot to mention on each heart, there's a tiny silhouette of a dog.  PJ bottoms has one pocket only and as far as size, I chose an XLG  but usually wear a Large. Being 100% cotton, I wanted to allow for shrinkage. The pajamas are shipped from over seas, and even though the shipping time isn't instant to the U.S. I did however  receive (with tracking) within 16 days. I always reach out and ask each business  that I purchase from when can I expect my items to arrive. I received a prompt ,friendly return communication from Company reassuring me how long it would take to arrive. I was surprised to find there were 2 little charms included as a surprise gift of kindness that I put on my keychain. I'm very happy with this purchase, product, and Business.

First the size chart is different than what you would see normally. Definitely take your measurements and compare to the chart and send to Tian. Tian was very communicative and helpful throughout the process. I was on a time crunch and she got me the dress very quickly. I would say the dress is prettier on than in the pic or when you take it out of the bag. I did have to have the dress altered which adds to the cost of the dress but considering I purchased online and couldn't try it on it fit better than I expected. The style of this dress is very flattering for all body types. It covers a lot of imperfections. The dress material is good quality although it does require a slip. The dress was fairly comfortable and has a good built in bra. I am very satisfied with my purchase.

Very pretty, heavy weight.  This was a substitute for the Fawziya Luxury Crystal Clutch Purse Rhinestone Evening Bag that I originally purchased but had to return because it was too small for my cell phone to fit.  I'm happy to say that my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge fits in this purse just fine (even with the cover on the phone).  This purse is definitely beautiful, and has the same heavy weight, pretty "chain" and quality as the other one (right down to the presentation box it comes in), although I think the design pattern on the other one was much more stunning.  Don't get me wrong, this is still a gorgeous purse.  It's got a classic look that will go with anything, and feels like it was made to last.  Instructions on the tag that comes with these types of purses states: "Cleaning method and daily care:  Can not wash, daily care, avoid temperature, rain, scratch, fold, heavy load, overload.  Pay attention to mildew and avoid acid chemicals.  If you don't use your handbag for a long time, please put desiccant inside after cleaning the handbag, and wrap the bag with soft papers. Then put your handbag in a dry place."
summary: Beautiful, and my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge fits inside just right.

reviewText:
I purchased this head scarf for my sister who lost all of her hair this year after going through chemo for ovarian cancer. I knew she did not want to do a wig but also refused to go in public bald. I looked around online and found this and purchased it.

The head scarf is extremely soft and that was perfect since her scalp was sensitive. We love the colors because you can match it with so many outfits. The one downfall on the headscarf was when we got it there were no directions on different ways to use it. We stood there confused on what to do. So not ever having used these before I think there should be a list of directions on how you can style with them. We were at a loss.

I recommend the hair scarf and even though my sister is growing her hair back she is still using it and so do I! We now trade on and off. We love them and have purchased more colors. We are very happy.

This product was a personal purchase for myself at normal retail price.
summary: The head scarf is extremely soft and that was perfect since her scalp was sensitive

Update: October 2015- 3rd purchase (2nd with seller Lucky21.) This is the third time Ive bought the Active Basic Camis w/Built-in Shelf Bra through Amazon. The first time was a 2-pak through the seller Lucky 21. They were perfect so I ordered a 4-pak but the 4-pak was only available through one seller DiamondKit-I figured it would be a consistent match as they were titled the same Active Basic Long Camis in Large w/ Built-in Shelf Bra. Boy, was that a wrong assumption. They weren't even Active Basic brand but DiamondKits own & they didn't have a shelf bra but two foam pads sewn in a sling that after one washing was a wadded up mess. So being a PollyAnna trooper I tried again this time I made sure it was through Lucky 21 & I got a 2-pak exactly the same size & listing as the first time I bought them. They fit great & all was well until my back began to hurt from a scratching chaff. Turns out on comparing these to the first ones I bought, these have the elastic straps sewn in backwards so the scratchy heavy duty thread that binds the straps to the halter in back along with the tacked down material rubs against the shoulder blades. The first ones  bought have the straps tacked down facing the halter away from the skin. I don't know why consistency is a problem but I cant seem to get proper Active Basic Camis. Im going to shop around for another brand & hope for a better product.
summary: Affordable & Comfortable (see 2nd-3rd purchase experience for update)

reviewText: Soooo Cute.

My daughter loves these training pants. They are soft and colorful and she enjoys naming the animal she is wearing. I like that the padding is thick enough that if she does a few drips of peepee before making it to the potty, it doesn't drip down her legs or wet her pants. If you are looking for something to absorb more than a few drips then these are not for you, these are training pants, not diapers. Laundry gets washed daily in my home so there has been no staining or issues if she does have an accident in them. I recommend these to anyone who has a potty training child, especially those children with skin allergies. Disposable diapers/trainers have chemicals, these are cloth and are way gentle on the skin!

reviewText: I use these to help contain small accidents when I'm out and about with my two toddlers.  They do that job just fine and gives us all a bit more confidence in going out.

These serve their purpose well.  My toddler is aware of any slight wetness and he automatically runs to the potty.  They are easy for him to put on and take off.  He is doing well in these as they hold him accountable and makes him think about it more often.  His confidence has increased and he readily goes without being promoted to go.  Sure, there is one violet colored one in the pack and he thinks it's silly.  He has worn that once or twice at the house and they are not an issue to me or my husband.  Overall, these are good quality underwear.

I got this t-shirt for $5.95, so my expectations were very, very low. It arrived at my doorstep 3 days after I ordered it, which is way faster than I expected. Right out of the box (bag), it looks sharp. Nice coloring on the letters, and it's a true navy blue color. The letters are not stitched, just regular iron-on type style. It is, at best, made of average material, some might say it is slightly below-average material, but it seems pretty standard to me. It is not a super-thick t-shirt, again, at best, it is average thickness or maybe slightly below-average in thickness. And due to the fact it is made of average or below-average material, I have no doubt that after repeated washing, the letters will start to crack and flake off. But after one washing, it is fine, it looks great, and it was $5.95 so...that easily makes it a 5-star purchase. This is a no-brainer buy. Great value for the money.

reviewText:

I own 2 Carter rompers in same size but the French terry (I think it's called) and they fit. Still snug around head, but he wears them. Can't wear cloth diaper with those, however.

reviewText:
Originally I purchased this set to have a few for myself for winter and the rest were going to be donated to our local homeless outreach. However, once they arrived I had to change things just a little. These are not women's size. They are children's size. All of the gloves are fuzzy and warm, they feel soft, but they certainly are not women's size. I have smaller sized hands and they hardly stretched far enough to fit me. My kids are happily enjoying them

I am still donating some of the pairs, a friend of mine helps the kids at school who are low income and can't afford them. They will serve the purpose and my kids can each have a pair. They are warm enough to be worn for day to day keeping hands warm, just not enough to be playing in the snow or anything like this.

*I RECEIVED THIS PRODUCT AT A DISCOUNTED PRICE (IN ORDER TO TRY IT AND REVIEW) THIS DOES NOT GUARANTEE A GOOD REVIEW OR CHANGE MY OPINION ON THE PRODUCT, I AM HONEST AND UNBIASED, ALL OPINIONS ON IT ARE MY OWN AND BASED ON THE PRODUCT ITSELF. I HAVE TRIED THIS AND EVALUATED IT ACCORDINGLY

reviewText:
Though these 12 Pairs Of excell Womens Soft Warm And Fuzzy Solid Color Winter Gloves are labeled for women, they are much better for children.  The gloves are super soft and I was able to wear them but they just covered my hands.  The color mix is good, I would have preferred less pink and more neutral colors.

I do quite a bit of babysitting and these gloves will come in handy to keep the children's hands warm.  My mother used to buy me magic gloves when I was a little girl.  They fit in my tiny coat pockets and I had something warm if I hadn't planned properly for playtime outside.  These remind me of those magic gloves that are very small but fit many hands.

reviewText: Great for fly fishing and excellent in high sunlight!
Great product. Optics are very good and the glasses are very comfortable.

I needed better sunglasses for a horseback packtrip. I have been using wrap-around sports style sunglasses bought at WalMart. The advantage of the sport-style is that they won't break if they are hanging from my neck, and I smash them against the saddle while mounting (or w/ rough treatment during the packtrip). I wore my new In Style glasses on an all-day ride to try them. My vision wearing the In Style is much clearer, and I didn't need to take them off in darker woods, like I do w/ the sport-style. The In Style did NOT slide down my nose.
 The CONS of the In Style are:
~ a frame that can potentially break w/ rough treatment
~ not dark enough for bright sun, even while wearing a hat with a brim
The PROS of the In Style are:
~ If the need arises, it's nice to have the bifocal available. It was in a good place for me.
~ noticeably clearer vision
~ side-vision is intact
~ better for cloudy days, not full-sun
summary: Like these sunglasses, but need to bring a 2nd darker pair for bright sun

reviewText: I originally bought this hoping to use it as a commuting tote, but it has an open top and that's a no-go for me, personally. Instead, I use it as a diaper/necessities bag for my toddler and preschooler. Fits my little diaper change supply bag (wipes, hand sanitizer, cream and 6 diapers), big sunscreen, Epipen, two sweatshirts, two sun hats, with room for additions clothes, various small toys, snack containers. The one drawback is the little zipper pouch is kind of small and detaches; I guess you could use it as a wallet for money and your id, but I don't. I think I have a pen in there, but it doesn't add to the bag for me (thus the 4 stars). This is a nice size bag though, I love the more sophisticated color palette and the open, easy access (particularly now that we have to carry the Epipen everywhere). I considered getting a Timbuk2 tote for my diaper bag/tote, but for a fraction of the price, I am very happy with this tote and can see it being used for many years to come. I think this would be fine for a work or farmer's market tote.

I ordered this because I am super picky with my warmer-weather wear. I HATE that women's long sleeve shirts are a ridiculous thin material and if they are not super thing, they are chunky cardigans or knit sweaters with knit gaps too large to offer any real warmth. I am on a quest for quality warm long sleeve shirts without resorting to filling my winter wardrobe with chunky shrugs and holey shirts. Since that is basically impossible to find in Central IL where I live, I resorted to online shopping despite my dislike that i cannot actually see the item to test the material or size.

Now that being said, I love this shirt. I was elated to find the material is heavier than traditional thin long sleeve shirts, not holey like a big knit, and warm. Its not QUITE as warm as I would like, as anything thats not 75 degrees outside is cold to me. It doesn't do much to make my petite frame look less so, but thats normal for me. However, it is the first shirt to actually meet what I was looking for. I love the pattern, its not plain or over the top. Perfect. At a mall this shirt would have been on average, $30 or if it was Buckle a ridiculous $65 and I would have mourned its loss (no way would I pay irrational prices like!).

It received four out of five stars for just one reason: Its a bit short in the torso. I'm 5'3'' and 125 lbs so I thought I would have been a fairly close fit to the size.  I plan to get other patterns now, just in medium lol.

OK, can't resist chiming in.  Mass is scalar and velocity is a vector.  Both mass and velocity can be time dependent, irrespective of whether they are a scalar or vector quantity.  The classic example of a variable mass problem is a rocket, that burns fuel as it accelerates.  Differentiation of the momentum when both mass and velocity vary with time is through the product rule of (ordinary) differentiation.  d/dt(mV) = mdot*v + m*vdot.  Sorry for being pedantic, but I'm a real life Mechanical Engineering professor who has taught this class several times...

There is another issue here.  The meaning here is "may the result of the forces be with you," rather than "may the force be with you!"  ;-)
summary: Yes the mass is a scalar...

reviewText: Those who question the math may be missing a critical part here. Notice the v following the m indicating a product of mass times velocity. Velocity carries the vector component and so the product of the assumed scalar mass times the vector velocity is a vector. Similar with the change over time, if you assume the mass doesn't change over time, the product of mass times velocity implies the velocity changes. Although in real life I find that my mass most certainly does change over time, not always in the way I prefer.

The cord/rope used is pretty good quality too.

 I bought 3 while at the gift shop, and ordered another from Amazon. I gave them as gifts to my bridesmaids and they all loved them.

I've also purchased snaps from Amazon, the soleebee brand, and those 5.5 mm snaps  fit as well

I absolutely love that this is a piece of jewelry that you can change out to match all of your outfits.  It makes this one very versatile piece.  This looks exactly like what is in the photo and seems very heavy duty.  I have a small wrist so it was much bigger than I needed, however it is adjustable.  I was able to wear on the smallest setting and there were quite a bit of bracelet "circles" left over if that makes sense at all.  I just unattached the left over circles and the bracelet is the perfect size for me now.  It looks much more expensive than the actual cost of the bracelet.  My only complaint and why I took away one star is that I wish it came with at least one snap charm.  If you wear it backwards without a snap charm it still looks okay but it would be better with a charm.  Also when I was trying to order charms to fit it, I found that it was very difficult with the description of the bracelet to determine what size charm was needed.  I received this product at a reduced price for me to test and review. I buy almost exclusively online and I rely heavily on reviews in order to decide what items to purchase. My goal is to highlight features and drawbacks that I would want to know about as a buyer. I try to write meaningful and thoughtful reviews for each item.

This is an extremely high quality bracelet. I see a lot of cheaply made jewelry out there that just falls apart within weeks of wear. This bracelet is made to LAST! Excellent craftsmanship and materials. It's very shiney  and pretty too! It's a great concept of personalized jewelry, you can pick from so many "Nugz" charms to pop into it for a different look every day! I'd recommend this bracelet to every girl who likes to look good and change it up on the daily. Awesome product! I received this at a discount  in return for my honest review, and believe me my reviews are always brutally honest!

** Update: its been almost 2 weeks, and 2 of the hoops at the end have disappeared! They must have broken off without my noticing. It's not a big deal to me, because out of the 4 hoops i was using the second one, and only the last 2 came off, but this does say something about the quality of the bracelet. And here I was ranting about how high quality it is! Maybe this is a rare occurrence, but I don't think any part of a nice bracelet should break after less than 2 weeks. Just sayin'!

When if first got this silver toggle bracelet by Nugz Jewelry, I didn't quite understand what it was. I thought wow this is a weird little pendant that has on it with the "Nugz" label. However after I looked around on the post and really understand a hundred percent what it was,I thought it was super cool. Pretty much you can make it into any bracelet you want, for any ensemble you're wearing. They have a bunch of interchangeable snaps that you can buy to replace uneven glass flaps which I thought was pretty cool. I can't wait to order a couple more snaps. I like the fact that they even have snaps four different types of styles. The bracelet itself is pretty nice call Mo however I wish it was all staying silver. However, it is just silver plated. I looked on the description and couldn't figure out if it was silver-plated what comma however it would be cool if it was silver-plated stainless steel. There are three ropes that connect each band, and it is held together by a "T" piece and a loop that it connects to. There are multiple loops to adjust the bracelet to your size wrist. It's kind of hard to get it on at first, and I was worried that I might not be able to get it off single-handedly, however it's much easier to get off than it is to get on. It is a little heavy, and is not very dainty so definitely not for someone who doesn't mind having something larger around their wrists. It seems pretty heavy duty and hasn't turned my wrist green yet so I am happy with this purchase and can't wait to try out some different style. I receive this product at a discounted rate
summary: Change the pendant suit your needs.

reviewText:
This is really a well-made bracelet. I like its weight and style.

This bracelet comes without any snaps and is intended to be used with snaps. A snap is a  decorative button that snaps onto the face of this bracelet. Without a snap, this bracelet does look ok, but it is definitely enhanced with a snap.

I also bought "Souarts Mixed Random Snap Button Jewelry Charms" on Amazon for $8. It's a pack of ten snaps and they work great with this bracelet.

It is very adjustable. A toggle pin fits into multiple loops located at the end of the bracelet. I found no trouble finding the size I wanted for my wrist.

I purchased this bracelet at a discount in exchange for my honest review.
Very nice piece of jewelry, love that I change the look with different snaps!

Depending on what you are using it for it may or may not be what you want. I wanted it for face protection, for warmth at night during cold weather camping and to reduce condensation in the tent. It provides face protection as expected. As far as condensation, I felt it was uncomfortable when the temperature got close to the dew point and would be better left off or a different type of fabric mask used. It just retains too much moisture and in cold weather camping was too cold. In warmer temperatures this is really nice for skin protection and to keep the skin cooler too. Just pour water on it and put it back on. It also helps with bug protection. I wish I would have thought about taking it on that fateful hiking trip when that vampire tick got me.  Aargh!!!

I invite any exhibitionists out there to make an instructional video on how to put this on the right way!  It would make a great comedy on an adult site! All in all, however, the price was right, even though it got a small tear first time I attempted to put it on. The excitement and novelty were worth the price and it delivered within 2 days as promised with Prime free S/H.  Do get at least one size larger than you normally wear.

I have read a few negative reviews about these burp cloths and I would like to share my positive experience with these Zebi burp cloths.  We were gifted a set of 2 and I didn't use them much when my baby was a newborn because we went through burp cloths like crazy and mostly used those thick prefold diapers (by Gerber and Dundee).  Once my baby was about 3 months, we had washed the prefolds so many times, they started to feel stiff and scratchy.  The Zebi cloths actually get softer and softer with washing.  Some people reviewed that they were too thin.  They are thin, but they are plenty large enough that you can fold in half or even quarters to give you more thickness.

At 3 months he started showing early signs of teething and was drooling non stop.  He hated the scratchy prefolds on his face, but doesn't mind these super soft Zebi cloths.  We started to use them so much that I purchased another set of them.  They are plenty absorbent, and due to their size and light weight, they are far more versatile than a prefold.  I've used them in a pinch as a carseat cover, a lap blanket, and even a teether.  He likes to suck on it, and since it's organic, I have no problem with him putting it in his mouth.

These have become a "must-have" for us.  We always have one in the diaper bag, and I pretty much have one permanently attached to my shoulder.  As an added bonus- the colors and patterns are ADORABLE.  By far, the cutest ones out there.  Now that my baby is old enough to start responding to shapes, he enjoys looking at the bold patterns.

In summary: we have gotten MORE use out of these than prefold diapers, and I highly recommend them.
summary: We LOVE our Zebi Burp Cloths!

reviewText: We received several types of burp cloths before our daughter was born. After the first 6 weeks of her life, these are the only cloths we use. They're soft and thin, perfect for slipping under her chin to catch dribbles of milk when she's eating. They're also surprising absorbent for the occasional spit-up incident. The dry fast as well. The patterns are pretty great too. We have 3 sets of these cloths and absolutely love them. My sister is having a baby in May and she will definitely be getting some of these for her daughter. We love Zebi.

I bought some of these seeing all the great reviews! They were right, these cloths are super soft and versatile. They are thinner than a typical burp cloth but softer and organic. I don't mind if my daughter chews on them. The prints are adorable, can't wait to order more!

reviewText:
I love the design of this. Alice doesn't move up or down, so it is a bit unexpected for people to see and most are delighted when they understand what it is. I also love the little book near the back by the clasp.

My only issue with this necklace (and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5) is that the chains are not individually linked. They are in groups of 5 or so which means they chain doesn't move as fluidly and often little sections will get stuck at odd angles - very unlike a chain. I don't know the reason for that (does it save money?), but I tend to find it frustrating the more I wear it.

Nice backpack... I use it for everyday even just as a purse. I can fit my Sony VAIO laptop no problem as well as many other things. I did a lot of research before purchasing this bag because I had a similar one that was very saggy and was worried this would be the same. But it's sturdy, with nice padded straps and a lot of compartments to put things in. All the reviews are pretty accurate. The buttons actually snap instead of being magnetic... this is good so that the flaps don't releases but rather keep your bag shut. Alternatively you could unbuckle the straps each time but this is inconvenient. Pretty nice size... could be just slightly small for a tall big man and would still be a nice small to medium sized back pack. For women it fits like a big backpack but is not at all too bulky, just the right size. For the most part it's pretty unisex. The color is actually not so tan as pictured but a cross between tan and army/khaki green... I love it... rugged and tough, pretty cool looking. This is a great bag for everything from school, traveling, fashionable purse, hiking, picnic... I plan on this being my world-traveler bag :)

Overall, I'd recommend this bag. Very solid.

reviewText: I was not looking for a nice wallet when I purchased this wallet. I was looking for something that was cheap and practical. I searched Amazon for wallets. Clicked four star or more and then cheapest to most expensive. This was one of the first bifolds to come up. I bought it. Pleasantly surprised.  The quality is significantly higher than what you would think you would get for $6. It is not too bulky. The leather is great. I'm considering buying it as a gift for my dad now. Both my gf and sister have commented on how nice of a wallet it is. Worth the purchase.

I really like this wallet. I ordered this at a discounted rate in order to test and review. I am very pleased with this purchase. I ordered it to put up as a Christmas present for my son. It is a real leather! I was concerned about that when I ordered, but it's a very nice wallet! It opens up and has two different sections for cards on each opening. There's four different sides to put things. The back also opens up for dollar bills and such. There's a plastic opening for ID or license which is easy to get it in and out of. (That's a must). This is a really very nice wallet. It's a soft, flexible leather that I really like. It's not hard or stiff at all, but very easy and the perfect size to stick in your back pocket. This is a great buy!

reviewText:
One can opt to purchase any one of the many faux leather wallets from you local department stores, glued and heat pressed together, or you can go for the more hand-crafted look such as provided here from Tiding. I like this more natural look, and give it a thumbs up.

As seen in the listing pictures, this wallet has three sections with the center section being stitched in containing additional credit card and ID slots. Not really a true tri-fold design so it is thinner (thankfully) than some tri-folds; it has three horizontal card slots in each wing, three horizontal slots in the center portion, and a "photo slot" in the center portion into which my driver's license easily fits. All of the slots are made with enough space to fit any credit, debit, or convenience card that I have...

This wallet really does have a great look & feel to it. At 4.25 inches long (folded), 3.75 inches tall, about 3/4 of an inch thick, and weighing in at about 2.7 ounces (per our postal scale), it is not the smallest wallet in my inventory but it is one of the nicest looking and seemingly best put together (nice, uniform stitching).

If you are looking for a wallet of this size, style, construction and price, for use as noted above, then we would recommend giving this wallet from Tiding a try based on my experience with it.

Recommended.

Go for it.

We received this item gratis from the manufacturer or seller, without obligation, and decided to objectively test and review it. My statements in this Amazon listing review reflect that testing experience. Amazon's new review system does not allow us to remove the "Verified Purchase" indicator from the review reference; we would if we could, given the gratis nature of this transaction.
summary: Tiding Leather Mens Wallet - Three sections - 9 credit card slots - Brown - Looks genuine, classsy & hand crafted - Recommended

reviewText:

Is a bit stiff out of the box, maybe because is GENUINE LEATHER, but I am sure it will loosen with time as REAL LEATHER DOES. It is quite big for my personal taste (4.43 x 3.64 inch and with 3 bank cards, 2 ID cards, and 4 club cards, is about 1 inch width), but is very comfortable to wear at least with jeans (I have not had the opportunity to tried it on other types of pants for now).

I am actually, and gratefully, surprised with this product and if everything stays as it is, Tiding just got itself a new fan.

reviewText:
So far, this is the third time I've ordered this necklace. I love the look of it and don't wear it often, but it gets lots of comments when I do. The first 2 I ordered were great! Still are great, but I tend to give them to friends who really love them so I needed more. This last time I ordered 2 necklaces. They came about 2 weeks earlier than expected which I love! One arrived the same as the other 2 in the past, perfect shape. (aside from one little crystal falling out, but that is an easy fix and I'm not worried about that) The other arrived with a broken piece that holds the heart onto the wing. I already emailed the seller and am waiting for a response. These are still beautiful, arrived quickly and were at a great price, but perhaps could use an extra glance over in quality control.

*Update* The seller sent out a replacement for the broken necklace, it also arrived much faster than expected and was in perfect shape. I am very happy with this necklace and my experiences with this seller.
summary: Beautiful and fast, but not everything can be perfect

reviewText: Old and too dried out to use

After a couple of weeks of 'testing' I am slowly warming up to this 'jack of all trades' watch, provided by vendor at a tremendous discount as a 'for review' item.

When I say 'jack of all trades' I really mean it. This is an ambitious device meant to, besides showing the time of the day, day of the week and today's date, also act as an alarm clock, stopwatch, countdown timer (ground control to major Tom), dual-time display for another city, pedometer, calorie counter and compass. And it's backlit too. The watch is shock resistant and water resistant and it's quite comfortable to wear which surprised me as it is quite large, the dial surrounded by thick 'protection' with 5 not so small buttons too.

Controlling and using something this complicated and controlling it through button presses is not the easiest thing in the world, therefore the 18-page manual. Yes, it's in English and yes, it could have been done much better but keep in mind that the interface is limited to the 5 buttons and the LCD display. These being said, I found that some features work just great while others, not so much so let's discuss some of them.

- TRADITIONAL WATCH: not much to complain here. It's LCD, of course, and like I said, you get the time of the day 12/24H format, day of week, month and day of month, hour/minute/second, AM/FM if in 12H format and a little icon telling you about the weather outside (sunny, rain, cloudy, etc.). It wasn't easy/breezy to set but it was doable.
- STOP WATCH, COUNTDOWN: these are okay. You do need to 'learn' how to use them and the manual is not your best friend but they work to some extent.
- WORLD TIME or DUAL TIME: I believe I could make this work if I spent more time with the manual. It has the ability to show time at 2 locations with a 3-letter abbreviated code for the non-default one.
- BAROMETER: there seems to be a lot of functionality here such as keeping charts and even showing your approximate elevation but I must admit that, beyond making the little 'sunny' icon showing up on the dial, I wasn't able to get much deeper. Blame the manual and my lack of patience in following the instructions.
- ALTIMETER: couldn't figure this one out at all but it seems to be there.
- PEDOMETER, CALORIE COUNTER: I spent some time telling the watch how many pounds I weigh and how tall I am but, in the end, it just didn't work. With or without the manual, it just doesn't work.
- COMPASS: works great. There is in fact a dedicated button that takes you right into compass mode and it's good. Nice feature.
- OTHER FEATURES: you can illuminate the dial which is good, select your units as either US or metric which is also good, set your time zone (read the manual very carefully).

Being as objective as I can, this is not a bad watch at all. It's a lot of learning if you want to use all features but I suspect that this is rarely the case. The manual can be better but it does explain how to do things, only it doesn't do it very well so it requires some time but it's usable if you do one feature at a time. The pedometer and calorie counter just don't work in my view. It's 3 stars because I do believe that this watch has potential and that the 'right' person may love it/want it, therefore my feature-by-feature evaluation above.
summary: Has many features, most work well but it's not easy to learn

It's really difficult for us big girls to order online. One company's XL is another company's XXXXXL. Having found that ordering XXXL is typically what I need, I ordered this shirt in XXXL, and it was ginormous. I had to go back and order an XXL, which is still a bit large, but I've read that it shrinks in the wash, so I'm confident it will be just right afterwards. Nice fabric, feels good, great selection of colors. By the way, I'm 5'3, 240, with DDD chest, for those looking for comparable sizes. I am rating this as five stars because you definitely get what you pay for. It was very cheap, so I wasn't expecting amazing levels of quality. However, it kind of exceeded my expectations. The material is not top notch, but I have had this for almost a year and it is still exactly the same as the day I received it. It hasn't faded at all (the colors are very bright and happy and I love the floral print, but the blue is a tiny bit darker than in the photo), there are no holes or fraying, and it still fits the same. The brim isn't bent and doesn't have too much give, which might be a bit annoying for some people, but that's what I wanted. I have a pretty big head (23"), and it fits me very well. It also fits my roommate and her head is much smaller (19"). It's a great first snapback for someone who wants to try this type of hat without spending loads of money. It's definitely on my recommended list.

I requested a return and refund and was asked to provide photos to prove they did not fit. I absolutely refused to do this and they offered to give me 20% back and I could keep them or send back at my cost. Not acceptable. I filed a claim with Amazon and was given a credit for what I paid. Oh also, the button hole wasn't even cut out so be prepared to grab a knife and slice these to button them, providing you can even pull them up all the way. reviewText: Bought this on a whim as it was a suggestion based off of prior purchases. I have had this wallet for over a year now. Absolutely love it! Also, it cheers me up whenever I see it.  There are plenty of slots and spaces for credit cards and other cards, as well as a space in the back for paper money. It comes with a coin purse and a clear spot to place your driver's license or ID card in for easy display. Even though the description says long green wallet, it is a great deal shorter than a checkbook and fits in my purse easily. Such a  fun item for everday use! If you're a Totoro fan this is a fantastic purchase.

I ordered this as a gift for my step mother, (being that she if Filipino winter garments are a safe bet that she will enjoy them.) The product took almost thirty days to arrive, not that I think this was bad. I ordered it on December 16 and it arrived January 7, too late for Christmas. It was shipped from China and I didn't pay anything to have it mailed to me.

I thought it would make a nice belated gift. Oh, how wrong I was...

Upon arrival I opened the package and found the scarf covered in black specs and gray dust inside it's plastic baggie. When held it up in front of me after unfolding it I discovered that the "scarf-arms" were sewn onto the hood at lopsided lengths. BY LITERALLY TWO FEET!

If I was to adorn this one the hand pockets wound have been just above my knee while the other would have at my naval.

It was constructed out of poor fabric with no significant cold weather warming qualities as far as I could tell (although soft I admit.) I find it interesting the model in the pictures is wearing this falsely advertised scarf to go with her skirt and T-shirt. and  The stitching was weak and liable to fall apart after moderate use. It smelled like a warehouse reeking of body odor and stale urine, I'm guessing the poor children who made this also live there.

No point in returning a $11.85 item to China, I tossed it in the garbage can where it fit in nicely with the rest of the filthy trash doomed for possibly a millennia of preservation in our landfills.

I understand there are glowing reviews for this product and they may very well have had a excellent experience. I however did not, and I'm perplexed as to how this is. For about ten bucks and a month of waiting your total losses can't be high, but a sham-job is still a sham-job.

Nuff' said...
summary: I'm fairly certain I just funded inhumane (as well as incompetent) sweat-shop child labor...

reviewText: I bought this wig for my 10 year old, for a cosplay costume she is dressing up for and it is fantastic! the color is exactly as shown, and the clip-on ponytails are great! it actually is 2 looks in one, as you can wear it without the ponytails too!  my daughter is very excited to wear it, and I have already tried it on myself to freak out the kids! I definitely recommend this wig, the quality is great, and it fits well!
summary: for a cosplay costume she is dressing up for and it is fantastic! the color is exactly as shown

reviewText: I'm sitting right in the middle on this one but I leaned toward the positive due to the totally fabulous fabric.  Snuggly, soft, warm. All that and not heavy. Quite a feat in the fabric world.  Hard to go wrong when you start out with something so great. Here I go again with quality craftsmanship. The hood looks like a very pointy hat, and it's white. reviewText: It is a very nice purse for this price. I have one problem is that sometimes it is hard to zip and the body of the purse has the tendency to cave in. It has a nice amount of space and the strap can hold up to the purse.

I was disappointed in this purse, mostly because of the color.

I ordered the wine-red purse for my mother to match her coat. I had the same experience as another reviewer, in that this was a bright red with purple lining.

It was also very stiff, and the zipper didn't work well. The gold zipper is very visible and really stands out; I would have preferred something a little softer with a less visible zipper, but that may be a personal preference. There's also a plasticky smell, but that would probably dissipate over time.

To be fair, there are several nice features too: The laser cutouts are nice and crisp (the side of each cutout is black when viewed at an angle), there are nice little feet on the underside to prevent scratching up the purse, and there is a small D-ring above the handle attachment on each side of the purse, for attaching a longer matching strap which is included. I ordered several items which arrived during a rainstorm, and this was the only one properly wrapped--there was a sheet of thin foam and the purse was wrapped in a plastic bag, so it didn't get ruined like the other items did.

Due to the color and the zipper issues, though, I am returning the purse. If the manufacturer plans to continue using the lot of red material used to make the purse I received, I'd suggest replacing the purse photo with a more accurate one, and revising the color description too--I see this more as a bright lipstick red.
summary: Stiff purse, visible zipper, wine-red color is inaccurate

Was I shocked when I got this in the mail today the original expected date for the package to arrive was the 27th of November it is currently the 30th but that's okay because this cosplay right here was definitely worth the wait. The pants are a bit big on me but all I got to do really is wear some boots and you wouldn't be able to notice. Another thing I noticed is this came with the gloves and the pin of the wolf that cloud normally wears on his armor (shoulder pad).

Another tiny problem I had was with the amount of belts it came with personally I don't have one cosplay that has these sort of belts on it but I managed to find a way to make them all tight enough so that they sit around my body and don't slip off. I am literally writing this review as I wear this cosplay if it's perfectly its super comfortable the quality is great and I must say my money was well spent if you're looking for a Cloud Strife cosplay this is definitely the one its not overpriced and it's not under priced it's just right.
summary: PRICE IS GREAT FOR A GREAT COSPLAY

reviewText: I purchased this in a size XX-Large for my 13 yr old daughter who is not an Amazon by any stretch of the imagination - it doesn't fit - it's so small she couldn't close it with the buttons in the front. Basically, you have to be a skeleton and no taller than 4' for this jacket to fit. I use the term "jacket" loosely because the quality of the denim is extremely poor: it's as thin as a t-shirt - this is definitely not meant to be worn for any type of warmth. The hood is attached via buttons and is small - like I said, this is not meant for anyone over 4'. The jacket worn by the model appears to be long and big enough to button up - but appearances can be misleading, and in this case, they really are. If you're petite, it might fit, but anyone taller than 4' will just be throwing their money away. FYI, this ships direct from China (!) and takes a while to arrive, so you can pretty much forget about sending it back. What a waste of time and money. My 13 yr old was eagerly waiting for the jacket and was so greatly disappointed when it arrived.
summary: Waste of money, flimsy, poor quality

reviewText:
First of all I'm wondering what happened with other reviews that I could read here before I bought this little coat.? I swear they were right here. Is this a good practice to erased them? I also remember the page with item had measurements for all sizes. This  also disappeared/ How strange.!
 Anyway, I'm writing my review not be sure if it survived here a minute. This little coat runs small, which means that 2XL feels rather like M. The fur is real and you can remove it ; runs all the way around attached to the coat with little buttons.
I'll give you measurement for 2XL:  long (from outside)-34,5in ,sleeves( have cuffs) and run as long as 25in and wide around (widest point))15,5 in;  shoulders ( from outside) -16in,around waist (from outside laying flat) -38in, tight - 43,5in.
FUR: long - 67in, the hair by itself is hanging as long as 6in (around neck) but in front is shorter -4in .Generally speaking, the fur looks very modest,but coat overall is made with attention to details. In front  coat has plastic zipper and buttons with decorative loops.
summary: Is this a good practice to erased them

Leather jackets tend to run small, so I knew to order up a size.  I have broad shoulders and can normally fit a size 12 top.  I ordered the size XL in this jacket.  It fits well and has room for me to wear a bulky sweater underneath without looking like a sausage stuffed in a casing.  The jacket is very well made.  The seams line up perfectly and the leather is buttery soft.  I prefer the zipper front to buttons, as the zipper prevents the jacket from gaping at the hemline and exposing more of me to chilling winds.  The zip-out quilted liner increases the versatility of the piece.  I am exceptionally pleased with this jacket and highly recommend it to others.  At this price, for this quality, it is truly a steal!

reviewText: I have been using Timberland leather conditioners for over 20 years, ever since they came in round bottles with caps made out of real wood. Typical with what is wrong with corporate America nowadays, with every new generation of these products, Timberland cheapens the product (but never reduces the price). Recently the company decided to have them replaced with even more watered down sprays(!) so I was trying to stock up on some of the older versions. The one pictured is of the second generation of Leather Conditioners which worked great. They contained the original formula (only in cheaper containers) which came in 50ml tubes: using just a couple of drops of it one could spit polish a pair of Timberland boat-shoes or boots. Unfortunately, what I got instead was the third generation Timberland "Boot SauceTM Conditioner" which may come in 100ml tubes but it is so diluted that one needs to use four times the amount with only very limited results. After returning this I will have to keep looking I guess.
summary: What You See Is Not What You Get

I bought this for my 3-1/2 year old son.  It fits great and and he loves it!  It is a very nice backpack. The zippers aren't made of a flimsy plastic and seem to be high-quality, durable zippers to withstand the constant zipping and unzipping of little ones.  Another feature that sold me was the padded shoulder straps.  The padding is in fact very plush for a toddler backpack (& esp. compared with others with unpadded canvas straps!).  I know I won't have to worry about my son being uncomfortable and not wanting to wear it on a trip or outing.  The first day we got it my son nearly wore it the entire day and I had to talk him out of sleeping in it.  I also like that it is made from a plastic coated canvas, so I think it will be easy to surface clean.

But be warned that there are different listings for this same backpack.  I was expecting this backpack to come with a rein for the parent to attach to the silver loop on the top and this came with none.  I see now that this particular listing pays no mention of the "parent rein".  I purchased this because I am traveling solo with our three-year old with eight stops in busy airports, so having the parent rein 'just in case' was an important aspect to my purchase of this product and I am very disappointed that the parent rein was not included. I will probably have to get a leash at the pet store for my son now. :/  Also, shipping was taking an extraordinarily long time and I came to find out this was because it was ship internationally from China, so keep that in mind if you are purchasing and want it arrive before a certain date.
Update: Added stars because this backpack has been so durable.  I gave this one to my grandson and bought a larger size for my son starting Kindergarten. I must say great things about a backpack that lasts longer than a school year!

reviewText: I thought the design was adorable, as I love sheep, but the "denim" color is not as expected. It is actually a very dark blue, which means that the black parts of the sheep don't show up. Instead they look like little amorphous white blobs. Not exactly what one is going for when one buys a sheep patterned scarf. The scarf itself seems to be decent quality, and if I hold it up to a bright light the print looks fine. Not sure how the other colors would look, they would probably be ok. Since the price was very reasonable and it shipped from China, I'm just going to bite the bullet and pretend they are clouds in a night sky.

reviewText: Better than what I expected

I was really pleased with this band at first. Looks great, great value for money, especially with the tool to get the spring rods in and out and a couple extra rods if you lose any. It's a little tricky to figure out how to adjust but a little googling will find you videos etc to do it. It even got easier to adjust over time - I frequently wanted to loosen or tighten it just slightly the first couple days I wore it, just to get it to feel right with daily use. I got a lot of compliments on how it looked.

Then I noticed the thing started loosening by itself a little. Then a lot- nearly fell off my wrist at one point. I wasn't too bothered by having to tighten it again every once in a while, but finally today, after it loosened itself I started  tightening it again, and the clasp fell off the band entirely. Now, even after putting it back on, it's won't stay in place anymore. Band is useless now.
summary: Looks great, clasp on mine loosened by itself and is no longer usable after about two weeks.

reviewText: I LOVE these! I want a pair for myself lol they do great machine washing and drying.  No falling apart or shrinking etc. If you're concerned about the decal on there though it doesn't really last that well. But just give them a try any how! Because they are so stretchy and snug at the same time they fit my 5 year old.  He is about a 6/7 but they could probably fit him for quite a few years because of the stretching.

My boys love their Knocker boxers! I purchased the boys size for my boys at ages 10 and 12, they are both of the same size, about 80-85lbs. Coming out of the package they look small like something that would fit a 5 or 6 year old. Keep in mind that these are  made of knit which stretch. These boxers should be able to fit a boy from about 40-50lbs up to 90 or more. My boys are still wearing them a year later and love them yet. The detailing will wear off, but for me comfort for my boys was utmost in my mind when purchasing. A year ago when I purchased them they fit like a glove and they do yet which is how they should. It's the way they were made to fit. Also they stay in place with no ride up at all which is a huge plus. I wash them with of all the other clothes in cold or warm water and also dry them in the dryer and they do just fine. I've now purchased the Knocker boxers in the junior one size fits all. They are a little big, but my older boy does wear them. The junior size will fit them great once they get to 100+lbs. Definitely a great purchase!!
summary: My boys love their Knocker boxers

This is awesome. The original purchase I made entailed me going with an xl which  was way too small. I am about 6"2 slim and muscular. Waist size 33 and shoulders a bit broad. I weigh between 190-195. I only give out my specs to perhaps assist a potential customer to gage which size would be suitable for him/her.  I decided to go with a 3xl and it was  perfect. Shopping for clothes online not being afforded the opportunity to exercise a fitting room comes with risks.

The return process was ok. I was eager and excited after knowing how the Jacket fit when finally receiving the right fit. Being a Prime member came into play. 2 days after my order the coat was at my front door.

When I put this on with the correct size the coat looks extremely expensive. I've seen other coats of equal or less caliber go for over $80.00.  Now...does the material feel cheap. Yes and no. I won't lie to you. The feel is WONDERFUL but the stitching can seen cheaply constructed. You aren't purchasing a sport's coat from Mens Warehouse. So keep your perspective grounded and rooted in reality. This coat just looks good on the body. I could tell people that I paid over $100.00 for the coat and won't feel a reluctance to say it. Moreover, people would believe me.

In my opinion clothing in general is overpriced. I have walked into malls and seen cheaply made clothing with riddiculous prices. I love blazers and I am telling you that form the price of this coat coupled with the look....CAN'T beat it.

Getting a wrong size should not be indicative I'm the quality, look, & style of the sport's coat. These coats are so fashionable. Especially the two toned ones. Hope my review was helpful. God bless.
summary: Best Sport's coat for thr price $. Can't beat it!!!!

I wish they made some like these with screw-on ball ends, they would be so much easier to change. I like to change my earrings alot. Or, they could pilot a hole in each side of the ball so the hoop stays in there easier when putting them in. There is only an indentation on each side of the ball for the hoop to fit in (as is true with all captive-ball earrings that I've had). They are a five, but I dinged the score for how hard they are to put in.

reviewText: Knowing it would run small, I ordered an XL for my daughter who wears a 10. It's a bit small even for her, but still looks affordable and she loves it!

I got this coat within the expected delivery. Not fast, but not late either.
As for sizing, I got an XL, and I wear a US S, sometimes M. It fits just right. A little tight at the arms but nothing to worry about (I have rather thick arms). When ordering it, make sure to review the sizing, as they recommend to go up about 2 sizes. To put it into perspective, I think only people up to a small US Medium would fit in this coat, keep that in mind.
As for the coat itself, it is surprisingly nicely made, it had no unpleasant smell to it (as I've seen others review). The shape, color, and even buttons look just like the picture; and it actually is very comfortable to wear! Nice and soft.
My only problem were the buttons, yes they were a little loose but not to the point where they could fall off. The thing is the holes for the buttons are too small, you can't even button the thing lol, but then again, nothing that can't be fixed.

Overall I am very very happy with my purchase, it is very nice, great looking, soft, fits me, etc. If you are considering getting one, just review the sizing and consider going up 2-3 sizes larger, depending on your body type.
summary: Very nice, make sure to check sizing.

When fastening/ undoing the buttons on the front, they will commonly get caught on loose threads, which are very abundant around the holes and buttons. The material is thin, but will hopefully hold up for a few wears.
The fit is very narrow, but that is what I paid for. I am 6'2, at 190 lbs. Athletic build with narrow midsection. The fit is fine around the chest. Stomach is pretty narrow, but that is the slim fit. The shirt is fairly short on me, as it just reaches my belt (I have a long midsection; would definitely fit better on a shorter stature). I guess that is the style, though.
Would I buy again? We will see, after I put this shirt through the runs. Upon first impression, the quality is somewhat cheap. The design is nice, with graphic interwoven on one side, and a fashionable striped inside collar for accent.
The real question of quality will be answered upon the first few washings.

reviewText: Based on the quality, worth is $19.99.

Not sure what the mixed reviews are all about unless due to different head/face shapes.  These glasses fit my somewhat narrow face extremely well.  They are light, strong and the lens quality, for mid-grade plastic, is exceptional.  The frames and temples have a soft, semi-flexible feel to them-  not hard, slippery plastic, and not the too-flexy-rubbery.  They stay put even with vigorous activity.  My long eyelashes do not drag on the lenses.  They are comfortable after hours of wear.  Lenses ARE polarized and aside from the annoying hazy dots made visible in acoustic auto glass and the inability to read most matt-finished screens (typical of most polarized lenses), they ease and enhance my vision.  The bronze has an "amber-boost" to it without looking like shooting goggles!  NOTE: I purchased the tortoise frame/bronze lens combo so I cannot offer an opinion on other configurations.  I got mine on a lightning deal for less than $25.  At $80+, there are likely better glasses out there, but for under $40 (if you can find them) - well worth it.  I WILLL be buying the same model with black and/or gray frames when I hit the right price.
summary: Light, comfortable, durable, good-looking, well made, high functioning glasses

reviewText: I got these severely marked down on an instant deal figuriing perhaps I was paying the real value. I am the $15 sunglasses sort of guy usually, figuring that no pair of shades could be worth much more. I was wrong. These really are top quality sjhades with exceptional lenses that do the best job of reducing glare of any sunglasses I have ever owned. Are they worth $150? Probably not.but I was very impressed with the quality.  The description says "non-polarized" but on the arm of the glasses it is stamped "polarized" and the ones I got are definitely polarized. I have extremely glare sensitive eyes and, for me, polarized is a must. So they do a great job of what they are supposed to do.  Fit is great on my large head, and the case itself is the best case I have ever received with any pair of glasses, prescription or otherwise, I have paid $20 for similar cases that were not as nice!  I did NOT get this for free or a reduced price nor do I pay much attention to reviews from those who DO get the product for free. If you prefer that honest reviews from those who actually buy the product are featured, please click "LIKE" so Amazon knows you prefer "real" reviews......
summary: XLNT Glasses - Worth the Price I paid plus - Mine are both Polarized and Reflective

reviewText: I purposely ordered a larger size, but it was still too small

I gave this 4 stars for good manufacture and construction. Pay attention to the 'loose fit'. It's loose fit upstairs, but below the waist it's not. This would be good for women who play golf or tennis or other sports where you need plenty of arm movement. The fabric does not stretch in any way at all. It's woven polyester not knit polyester--so no stretch at all. The color was true to what I saw on the screen. I ordered what was title as 'scarlet' but looked orange, thinking it was due to my monitor. What I got was true scarlet--which tinges to orange (check scarlet (color) on wikipedia. My bad. I thought I was going to get crayola scarlet which is red. Believe them when they tell you what color it is.
It fits, and I'll wash it a few times to soften the material up, but my mistake was selecting the color and not realizing it didn't have ANY STRETCH.
summary: The colors are true, the fit is correct--no stretch

reviewText: I purposely ordered a larger size, but it was still too small

I gave this 4 stars for good manufacture and construction. Pay attention to the 'loose fit'. It's loose fit upstairs, but below the waist it's not. This would be good for women who play golf or tennis or other sports where you need plenty of arm movement. The fabric does not stretch in any way at all. It's woven polyester not knit polyester--so no stretch at all. The color was true to what I saw on the screen. I ordered what was title as 'scarlet' but looked orange, thinking it was due to my monitor. What I got was true scarlet--which tinges to orange (check scarlet (color) on wikipedia. My bad. I thought I was going to get crayola scarlet which is red. Believe them when they tell you what color it is.
It fits, and I'll wash it a few times to soften the material up, but my mistake was selecting the color and not realizing it didn't have ANY STRETCH.
summary: The colors are true, the fit is correct--no stretch

reviewText: love it

I'll be honest, The only reason I bought the peacock design in these leggings is because they were $6.99 and all the rest were more expensive. I love leggings but love getting deals even more. Were these a deal? Well, I would say so. They aren't my all time favorite type of legging but the size small fits me just fine. I am 5'5', 127 pounds with a 29 inch waist. The waistband doesn't dig into my stomach or feel uncomfortable. The legs are long enough even with my 32" inseam. The colors are bright.

What I don't like is that these are that shiny material. I prefer the soft, cottony feeling type. These are also very thin. I wouldn't say this pattern is see through but I don't know how long the leggings will hold up since they are so very thin and lightweight. They are high waisted. I have a short torso so maybe that is why but I don't mind. They go to my naval and don't slip down at all when I sit or squat. I wouldn't wear these for working out because they don't have that stretch that I need. They DO stretch but these are more fashion leggings than tough workout ones, for me anyway.

For $6.99, they're fine. If I paid $10.99 like the rest are priced, I probably would have gone with 3 stars. But these are cheap, cute, they fit, and certainly won't be too warm on a hot summer day or night. The pattern is definitely loud but I can tone it down with a long solid top and simple shoes. I am eager to try another pattern because those look softer than the ones I got. If you don't mind thin shiny leggings, this pair in the peacock pattern is a good deal.
summary: For the low price, the peacock pattern leggings are fine.

reviewText: I love these soft leggings under a solid top for fun. They fit as expected and wash well.

Just received my order of this watch, which took over 10 days to receive. Now, the good. It looks great, the band is nice, and the band is comfy.

The bad for me. It is heavy, and, unlike a few watches I own of similar size, it ends up rubbing my wrist bone because of where the strap points are. That's me. You might like it.

Here's my real problems: according to the on-line manual, the battery will need to be replaced in two years. You can get that long with a regular battery. Most solar watches should last about 10 years. According to an email reply from Shark, the manual means it can last 2 years with charging. There are other contradictions in the manual, though.

More ominous, the manual states "Direct exposure to the sunlight will cause the watch overheat at the surface". What? It's a solar watch. Shark told me "you don't need to put the watch under the blazing sun for quite a long time." What is a long time? I'm very concerned when I read about a solar watch overheat in the sunlight.

So, it's going back.
summary: A solar watch that can overheat in sunlight?

reviewText: These were a gift but he really liked them. They seem to be high quality.
LOVE THEM

This is a very stylish and good looking belt with a great argyle design that goes with everything in my wardrobe from casual (jeans) to dressy (dress pants) since it has a lot of nice and bright colors. And the silicone is quite thick and the belt feels well made and should last a long time. Also because the belt is silicone it is very flexible and makes it very comfortable to wear and to clean the belt is super easy. Also, this belt is REVERSIBLE so you can wear just the black side if you want to tone down the colors and go with a more classic look. As for the sizing, my waist is a 32 and I ended up buying both the 34 and 36 with the intent of returning the one that didn't fit. I can tell you the 34 FIT PERFECTLY for me as you can see in my pictures. And the width of the belt is 1.5 inches and should fit practically every belt loop. Here's something I didn't know about belts: From the part of the belt that wraps around the buckle to the middle hole is the size of belt you're buying. For example, the 34 belts middle hole is exactly 34. Also, for this belt, every hole from the middle hole is 3/4 inch up or down rather than a full inch like most of my other belts. And the length of the entire belt from where the belt wraps around the buckle for the 34 is 40 inches and the 36 is 42 inches. Not sure if you can see the measurements from my pics Now I LOVED this belt in black so much I bought it in white as well PGA TOUR Men's Perforated Silicone Belt, Multi/White, 34. If that doesn't tell you how much I love the belt I don't know what will. P.S. All the measurements for the black and white belt are EXACTLY the same. And the middle hole is the 4th hole since there are 7 holes.
summary: Absolutely LOVING This Stylish and Comfortable Belt!!!

reviewText:
On the plus side, this corset seemed sturdy and well made (to an extent). The external fabric was very pretty.
However, it was certainly not as curvy as depicted. This was more of a modern silhouette - which is slender and long, not emphasizing a deep waist. This is not necessarily a bad thing, but it should have been in the description. As a curvy woman, the corset was painful and unattractive, even after two weeks of seasoning. It is definitely NOT recommended for any woman with anything more than a boyish figure.
Finally, after 3-4 weeks of wearing the corset, I decided to try lacing down to about 2 inches reduction (which was very difficult, due to the lack of hip and rib spring). I looked great, but after a couple of hours, I sneezed, and two of the pins burst out. I was in mixed company, and excused myself to the sound of chuckles (the guys thought I had passed gas). Only slightly embarrassing, but certainly not something I want to repeat.
I would like to reiterate that the corset is NOT as curvy as it looks, but if you are slender through the hips and rib cage, it will probably work out great for you.
summary: this corset seemed sturdy and well made (to an extent)

Upon closer look it was realized that holding the garment up to the light you could not see light through it which before you couldn't, this proved that the lint was in fact, the lining, and if this wasn't enough it was all over everything and couldn't be removed just by your hand you had to use tape and a professional lint remover to try to make any type of progress trying to remove the lint. The edges of the tiers are not finished i.e. there is no hem.  Each tier at the front has black fabric under it.  The back is a single layer of the printed fabric.  It is a lightweight fabric and flows very nicely.  It is not form-fitting below the bust.  I am 5'6" and my belly button is located at the bottom of the second tier or about 4" from the bottom. The Abody bag has cute styling including a sweet little tassel on the drawstring, and a little pouch attached to the strap. It arrived within 1 week of ordering. I ordered the Black. When not in use it can fold flat and be stored in the reusable gauze dust cover.
The 2 slip pockets and the zipper compartment on the back wall are hidden from view as the second drawstring closure acts as a flap until it is filled. This unique design doubles the security as a second closure. It holds everything I need including a larger wristlet, hairbrush, glass case,phone,little notebooks, and medications. A small computer tablet may fit. Though it was a tight fit it does hold my purse organizer. Negatives: It won't double as a tote ;it is not for the person who needs to carry books or, magazines. The interior is dark,making it harder to find items. The opening drawstring flap hides the interior slip pockets, and the back wall zipper pocket from view which could be a plus for security purposes, or a negative. Some reviews indicate they didn't have the pockets, but it may be the secondary drawstring flap covers them from view. The little pouch snap requires extra effort to close,working best from the top of the snap. There is a slight factory smell which will fade with age hopefully. I gave it 5 stars because for the money it is a very nice little bag for everyday casual wear.

reviewText: Too small, very cheaply made, came from China.

First of all, the product description claims these boots are made of suede.  Suede is leather.  There is no leather involved in the making of these boots,  They are entirely synthetic, and they smell like plastic.  The photo in the listing is just blurry enough so that you can't really tell, but trust me, in person these are fake micro-suede, and cheap stuff at that.  Second of all, they're very weirdly shaped.  It's as if they weren't designed to really be worn on feet.  The shaft is far too straight and narrow for the size of the foot which is really really wide, but the instep is so low it's really hard to even pull these boots on.  It's like they were made for kids or something...kids with stick legs and wide flat duck feet.  I even ordered a size up from my normal size and still there's just no way these actually fit on the feet of normal humans.

I've bought boots like these before.  Usually they're cheap but ok...I like them.  They're fine for wearing around the house.  I really expected these to be nothing more than cute slipper-boots, but they're not even that.  Plus, I paid way too much for them.  If you pay more than $10, you've paid way too much, and I paid over twice that amount.  You can buy these same boots, made better, at your corner catch-all store for half this price and NO shipping and NO month-long wait.  I'm ok with waiting a long time for good, artisan-made, high quality stuff.  But waiting a month to get a plastic bag of junk in the mail really hurts.

Unwearable AND basically, unreturnable.  Because just try to send stuff back to China...good luck.  When will I learn?  No matter how cute it seems, if it ships from China, it's cheap fake knockoff junk.  Sorry China.  You make junk, and loads of it.  Shame on you.  Shame on me for buying it.
summary: Junk shaped vaguely like a boot

Ring is even more beautiful in person. Very happy with the quality of this piece. The thickness of this ring is not so heavy that it's uncomfortable to wear (a common issue with many tungsten rings). The beveling is distinct and nicely dresses this ring.

Not only am I very happy with the ring, but the company's customer service is amazing. I unfortunately ordered this ring in the wrong size based on a different jewelers recommendation. I ended up having to return it and exchange it twice to get the correct fit. There was one simple form to fill out and it took less than a week from return to receiving the new item without any issues. Very impressed.

I would recommend ordering from this company to family and friends. The price is amazing for the quality of the product. I admit I was nervous to order such an important piece (wedding ring) of jewelry online without ever seeing or holding the piece, but I couldn't be more pleased.

reviewText: In about a week the lenses became too scratched to use.

I purchased these glasses more as an experiment to see if they had the same dimensions of the Oakley Holbrook. This would allow me to use many of my replacement lenses in the same frames as my Oakley's. The good news is they are the same dimensions and my replacement lenses work perfectly and offers an additional dimension to my lens / frame combinations for social and business use. The down side is I found the design to be not as wide at the ears as the equivalent Oakley's and this caused me some pressure above my ears and that lead to a headache every time 8 wore them. As a stand alone review without the influence of a pair of Oakley's these are ok but the narrowness continue to challenge longer term wearability. This could also be as these are designed for a market where a narrower head dimension is more common
summary: Very tight for me above the ears and Caused headaches. Shame they are great Holbrook impressions

A bit tight. I had intended to wear this over my pants - but probably will end up wearing them as pants in and of themselves.

UPDATE (1/21/2015)

As of wearing this soft shell in the upper Northern states for a winter, I have to confess that these pants are terrible.

-The material absorbs water. Not even remotely water repellent.
-They aren't very warm. My poly-pro underlayers are warmer than these.
-It does little to help against wind. It helps slightly, but not much.
-Impossibly small to wear, even for a larger size.
-Pockets. What the heck? No back pockets. The cargo-pockets are microscopic. The actual pockets at the hip are zippered and designed to carry maybe a small wallet and little more.
-Fabric. Is stretching and giving-out after wearing the pants for little more than a week or so.

SUMMARY.

Listen, if these are fabricated with "Asian size" in mind ... DON'T SELL THEM TO AMERICAN CUSTOMERS. Most Westerner customers do not like skin-tight clothing. The workmanship is shoddy,
the material is flimsy, and the product doesn't even live up to it's stated function: water proof, wind proof, warm. In the end, it's just a really crappy pair of pants that are
so-so warm, soaks up water, and isn't actually a "shell" that fits over your pants - IT BECOMES YOUR PANTS because it's so ridiculously tight.

Save your money, buy this: http://www.amazon.com/Helikon-ECWCS-Trousers-Generation-Black/dp/B005D6DX50/ref=sr_1_fkmr1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1421843933&sr=8-3-fkmr1&keywords=ecwcs+goretex+pants+black

Or just get a pair of used surplus military gortex trousers for about $30 if you don't mind wearing camo.
summary: Terrible. Doesn't Come Close to Fulfilling Stated Function
